description: image of a man with dark frame glasses in repose; his arms are crossed over his chest and his legs are crossed at the knee and ankle
portfolio: From Friends of the Artist: A Suite of Seven Etchings and Lithographs
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn. (until d. 2012); by descent to his daughter Catherine Andrus, Minneapolis; given to MIA, 2018.
text: Draftsman, painter, and printmaker, Bernard Chaet (1924–2012) taught for 40 years at Yale University. His landscapes and still lifes are full of the energy, emotion, and occasionally violence that one would expect of a scene of a football game or a battle. This portrait is part of a portfolio of seven that Barbara Swan made of artist friends who worked in New England.
title: Bernard Chaet
